ygData.messageBody:
I keep reading posts like this:
Level 45 TSK.
If I was to use my entire bar of mana on a mob I could tap 180 dmg out of
it. At my level that is about 3/4 of a bubble healing and not even a scratch
to the mob. Now at a cast time of 2.5 secs this is not a spell you want to
be casting when face up to a mob. Does to little damage to justify casting
during combat.

A ranger can cast a 99dmg DD for 70 mana, and Heal for 80dmg at 60 mana.

Thats 495 dmg and 400 healing for the same mana cost.

We dont even wanna go to paladin healing/mana efficancy

me thinks mr GZ is just snuffing his damn job and didnt really in house
balance test a damn thing.

If other hybrids get direct damage/heals that are so mana effeciant, why is
it unbalancing if the SK get the same? Why is our armor less ac then
rubi/ivy etc? I mean, they can even do there heals while not in combat. We
have to backup, (not swinging), and cast these spells... Why is it so
unbalancing? We are KOS everywhere. We have been on the nerfing end of
verant since the game started. What is SO powerfull about us that we get
these ungodly exp penalties, kos everywhere, BAD spells, lifetaps that cost
3 times mana that heal a level 1 necro, and items, ermm, our new armor kinda
sucks compared to everyone(except the paladins, lol, but at least they can
buff thereselves). I just dont get it. What is so tuff about a SK? Is there
something I am missing?
It seems that for the exp penalties and KOS, we should be better in other
areas. Paladins get the spanky swords, everyone else gets better equipment,
every other hybrids spells blow ours away. Hell, the warriors are getting
beefed up every patch, while we get these "bones" throwed at us, with hidden
nerfs in them...

Sorry for ranting/whining, but am I the only one that feels like we are
getting everscrewed?
